page.title: 01Southam:General Information
page.content: The ancient market town of Southam dominates this area of arable farmland. Two main routes cross in Southam: the north / south from Coventry to Banbury, and the east / west from Daventry to Warwick. An old Welsh drover's road also passes through Southam. Cattle from Wales were driven along this road to Market in London. The River Stowe flows from east to west, joining the Itchen at {Stoney {Thorpe Hall.}The village of{Stockton lies to the north east just off the road to Rugby. There is piped water,gas and electricity and a sewage treatment plant. The chief industries are the cement works to the north and agriculture. Many buildings of historic interest make Southam worthy of a visit.
